1.text: Set up a mirror where it’s easy to see.

2.text: Angle the mirror based upon the profile you want to draw.

3.text: Use a photograph in place of a mirror for easier reference.

4.text: Keep your drawing surface as vertical as possible.

5.text: Draw a circle in the center of the page.

6.text: Draw a vertical line down the center of the circle.

7.text: Measure half the diameter of the circle with a ruler.

8.text: Sketch 4 lines to connect the circle to the chin line.

9.text: Re-draw the horizontal line at the halfway point of your current drawing.

10.text: Draw a line at the halfway point between the eye line and the chin line.

11.text: Sketch a horizontal line at the center point between the eye line and the crown.

12.text: Make small, vertical dashes to split the eye line into 5 equal sections.

15.text: Sketch a vertical line from the inner corner of the left eye to the nose line.

16.text: Make a vertical line from the middle of each eye down to the lip line.

17.text: Add the hairline in between the 2 separate lines labeled “hair”.

18.text: Erase all unnecessary lines from the portrait.

19.text: Fill in the ears, areas in the eyes, lips, and nose.

20.text: Shape the jaw and cheeks based upon the angle of the face.

22.text: Hang your portrait in a frame that compliments your work.
